reviews.review_text: Important info before doing my review.  CPU: i5 3670k ( 3.40GHz ) GPU: GTX 670  I have not played the story mode yet. Just been doing online, and versus.  --- I normally don't do reviews, and I doubt my review will even be seen, but with the game getting bashed so hard. I wanted to give my opinion. I had the game preordered, and saw the reviews were terrible, I was scared the game was going to be bad, and run badly. So I started up the game. And so far my experience with the game has been quite nice. I haven't had any of the issues others have had really. Maybe I'm just lucky.  There are some small problems with this game like audio, and the fact that we have to go through the config files to actually change some options. But they can easily be (and hopefully are) patched. And even with the small problems, I don't think it deserves to get slammed like it is now.  From what I have seen a lot of people having problems with the game don't even meet the min requirements for GPU and/or CPU. There are exceptions of course of people with great cpus, and GPUs like 970s+ having problems.(Maybe is somehow more optimized for older GPUs? Idk). But again from what I have seen on the discussions page, a lot of the people complaining don't meet the requirements for this game at all. I think people just assumed because they could run Naruto UNS3, they could run this game as well or something.   In closing, the game isn't a bad port at all, BUT at the same time, it isn't a very good port either. It's pretty average, but the fanbase is making it seem like it's Batman AK.  If you actually meet the requirements of this game and want the game, buy it, you should be fine, and if not somehow, well at least steam refunds is a thing.   P.S. I've also played this on my friend's computer with a gtx 960, and it ran fine as well.

Alright i dont usually take time to write reviews but i will since i was very hyped for this game and I am a big Naruto fan.  Pros: So let's be clear, the game itself is amazing, very well done story mode, even including bonus story. Tons of characters which is always what we all want from a fighting game. Graphics are great. You most likely will need skills to play online multiplayer (Competitive or not). Community is fantastic and very nice. Gameplay leaves incredible battles like you have never seen before from a fighting game. Every game you play as something new to offer. Every characters can be played in different ways which makes it almost impossible to actually say: I played all character and seen all ultimates/awakening and now its boring.  Cons: Very bad optimized for computer. 30 fps lock. Multiplayer servers from high distance countries will most likely be unplayable (US vs France by exemple). You cannot mute players you are fighting against (which can turn out extremely annoying in certain situations).   Finally, the game is amazing, there are way more pros than cons, and the bad reviews given to the game are almost only related to the 30 fps lock/bad optimization.   You should definitly buy this game if you are a Naruto fan or a fighting genre player.

Game had a lot of problems at launch performance-wise, but they've been completely fixed as of the latest patch, which makes me very happy as a long-time fan of this series.  Pros:  -The graphics are amazing, CC has done an amazing job giving the series a good transition to 3d while maintaining the art style. -The fights are flashy and fun -Story mode (while uncecessarily lengthy at times) has some of the coolest boss fights in this game, I usually ♥♥♥♥ on 'cinematic events' and 'QTEs' but NUNS4's are really entertaining to watch (play?) -Lots of new costumes and movesets for pretty much every character -Character roster is huge -New mechanics effectively combine the old team mechanics from the previous games (which were screwed up in the last game, im very glad the team building aspect is back, instead of just 'pick a playstyle') -you can plug in two controllers and play with your friends, which has always been a feature but a lot of other games dont do it, i also mention it because the online play is garbage  Cons: -Adventure mode is boring -Online battles are awful, half second input lag, the winner is the one who cheeses the hardest. Pretty much every NUNS game is guilty of this -Not enough ability cap survivals in free battle survival mode -aside from the Sound 4 character pack, the DLC is pretty awful and overpriced -2 characters are locked behind pre-order  Overall: Game is great, Cyber Connect does it again. Pretty much all of the real gripes i have about this game have more to do with Bamco and their business decisions. I don't even like the Naruto series but i do like me some fast ninja fightan. Get this when it's on sale, unless you really feel like giving Bamco 70 american dollarydoos for the base game and season pass.

Terrible Port on launch  30 fps lock No resolution options. None. Only FXAA for antialiasing Game crashes every 20 minutes.   Didn't realize this was an early access title.   2/10    So I tried playing this game on not one, but 3 different rigs.  Controller - Steam Controller using Xinput  First rig, 'The Beheamoth'-  i7 4770k OC'd @ 4.5 Ghz Nvidia GTX 970 3.5GB Windows 10 16 GB ram  Performance results -  30 FPS solid, with a LOT of stutter, almost unplayable. Menus are slow and unresponsive some of the times. Crashes to desktop around every 20 minutes of gameplay, or right after a cutscene just before a fight.  Second rig, 'The Monster' -  i7 2600k @ 3.5 Ghz Nvidia 770 2GB Windows 7 8 GB ram  performance results-  30 fps, occasional dip to 25, not as noticable stutter as before but still there. Menu's are decently responsive, no crashes with 30 minutes of gameplay. Always launches into windowed mode, so always have to manually toggle fullscreen. Probably the most 'playable' of the three.  Third rig, 'The Little Engine That Could' -  i7 2600k @3.5 Ghz Amd HD 7870 Windows 7 8 GB ram  performance results-  20 FPS with occasional ups to 30, stutters whenever any jutsu or any over the top effect is going on screen. Heavy input lag on menus, about 2 second delay for buttons to be pressed. Crashes everytime after finishing Hashirama/Madara fight. Least playable.   With all that said, it baffles me that my top rig can't seem to handle it as well as my second, and it even baffles me more how varied performance is. It's almost like RNG.  Keep in mind I did force V-sync for every rig.  Bottom line is, this game is a mess no matter which way you cut it. If the game is runs alright for you and up to your standards, thats great but the fact remains more people than not are having issues, even those with actual gaming rigs and not terrible HP laptops.   Hopefully CC2 can at least correct some of these issues. Honestly, 30 fps doesn't bother me as much as the menu lag, the crashes, and the stutters. If the engine isn't physics dependant, hopefully a 60 FPS mod can be in the works for when this game can actually run on a Nasa super computer.

I am not going to lie. I am very upset with how this game turned out. The ninja storm story has always been the main seeling point of the game. The combat has always been mediocre at best, and is pretty bland. The story however was exciting and fun. However; it brings me to much shame to say that the story in ninja storm 4 is just terrible. Most of the funny and interesting cutscenes were removed and replaced with still images from the anime with a voice over, which is just god awful. The story was rushed, missing almost half of the content from the manga and the anime, and just about every major and epic thing from the kaguya arc was squeezed into two battles. The final battles with madara and kaguya take up just one small chapter and they have left out a lot of things that were important to the series. An example of one is narutos most powerful attack, the 9 tailed beast rassengan barrage that he uses on kaguya. It was scraped from the game completely. There are also a few mechanical issues with the game. One of the ones i noticed most was the audio issue with the story mode. Sometimes there are massive frame rate drops but that isnt very common and you wont always notice it.   So now that thats out of the way, heres a pro and con list for you guys who like it simple.  Pro list: > great combat (best in the series > many characters > cool attacks > a few really cool boss battles > adventure mode for added game time after story is done > online works well > final battle is really well done and almost makes up for all the flaws from the story mode (almost) > lots of collectables and items to unlock  Con list: > story mode was nerfed > audio issues with story > still images with voice overs replace cutscenes > kaguya arc was nerfed and misses most of the epic moments > a few really forced, boring and awful boss battles > AI is a nightmare in story mode > massive frame rate drop in certain parts of the game > story mode is short (took me 5 hours after skipping a few cutscenes. as opposed to the 10+ hours from the previous games)  All and all, its a fun game for a few hours. Because of the story mode being how it is i cant recommend the game if you are playing for that reason. If you want a game you can play with some friends then go for it, but wait for a sale

But this PC port, on it's current, state is just disappointing in too many levels, and not just because of the 30 FPS lock. The game honestly is pretty smooth even with the 30 FPS lock. The major issues for me are:  - Subpar cutscenes on story mode, that are all pre rendered with a really low quality, which make them even worse than a HD version of the anime (much worse than Full Burst 3) - Audio issues that make the sound of the voices only reproduce on the left speaker (no fix so far) - Lack of graphics options on the menu compared to previous games, which is just inexcusable  I suppose removing the 30 FPS lock would have been nice too.

Okay, here we go.  At this point in time my computer is only just slightly better than a toaster oven, but the game runs well enough for me not to tear it apart at every given moment, and that's at lowest settings without config edits. Is the game flawless? Hell no, it's in a shaky start. Does it deserve such terrible reviews, I honestly don't think so, this is no Arkham Knight. I don't know my exact specs, but my hardware is a few years old now, so it's not anywhere near top of the line. I'd give it a 7/10 in it's current state. I'll start with the Cons, to get the bad out of the way first.  Cons: -30 FPS Lock, despite being said that this game would be optimized well on the PC. -Slightly lower frames on menu screens. I go down 19 frames at most, usually it's around 24-27. Battles run pretty smooth. -No option to turn off mics in online play. Seriously, why? I know how to do it, sure, but I want to be able to fight someone without hearing a tornado rip their homes apart. -Slide show cutscenes in story mode. Seriously, this was a terrible desicion. -Low framerate when awakening. Usually affects Susano'o characters. -Crap keyboard support, as always. Doesn't overly matter to me since I have an Xbox controller to use, but still that should be better looked at.  I haven't experianced some of the other issues mentioned, so I can't comment on those.  Pros: -Great story. Seriously it was nice to finally watch Naruto come to an end rather than the dub being 30 years behind and the sub being to caught up in the infinite filler to complete the story. (FYI I did read the manga, notice how I said 'watch') Loved how they handled the final battle. -Animated cutscenes were great. Seriously if we had this quality of cutscenes during Obito's backstory, or when the mask fell off it would have been amazing. They all looked so well done, it's a shame a good portion was just a slideshow. -Better English dub acting. By far one of the highest points for me. In previous games several of the characters didn't show enough emotion in their lines. It's especially noticeable on Naruto when he shouts. This is the first time since Storm 2 that English Naruto's Rasengan actually sounds intimidating. This wasn't his actress's fault, but the people who handed her the script and told her to read it, and those who put weak sounding voices in the game rather than rerecording new ones. -Overall smooth gameplay. Minus awakening, menus, and not being 60 FPS the gameplay is pretty smooth, and that's really what needs to be done right in the end, as that's what makes the game actually playable, you know? -WORKING Online play. Last time I bought a Storm game (Full Burst) I regretted it immediately because the online was broken and by the time they fixed it they'd already begun hyping up Revolution. I can actually play the game with friends, rather than being disconnected partway through every match. -Adventure Mode is pretty good, a bit bland, but about what you'd expect from an Adventure mode.   Is this game perfect? Hell no. However it's definitely better off than Full Burst was. If they fix up the issues that can be fixed with it I'd easily give it an 8.5/10, maybe even 9/10, but as it stands now, it's at a very shaky 7/10. I have a few more personal things, but overall they're not worth mentioning. I'd still recommend it to fans of the series, as everything seems fine on my end. Here's hoping they fix the issues others are having swiftly so we can all enjoy it.

Many negative reviews are bashing the game for poor performance. During my playthrough of the game there were a couple frame drops mostly when there was a lot happening on the screen, which has been the case for almost all Storm games. In addition, many reviews are reviewing the game on performance alone with little to no playtime. This Storm game itteration was made to be more graphically intensive, which it is. So people expecting to jump from being able to run the earlier games to this one might be met with an un-welcome surprise.  However, I don't even have a high end PC and I am able to run the game perfectly fine. So people claiming that the game is not running on an up to date graphics card and processor, I find it very hard to believe. I am by no means saying the game couldn't use some optimization. If you are still sceptical about purchasing the game because of mixed reviews, I will almost gurantee the negative reviews will be flushed out by those who have finsihed the game, and also those who are aware of what their computers can handle in the next couple of months after release. Any Naruto fan will love this game but you need to make sure you can run it first. You basically get every major character even to appear in the anime/manga.  In conclusion, buy the game if you know what you are getting into. Steam refund is always there if you can't run the game in it's current state.
